growing.water: Moderate; keep soil evenly moist, especially during bulbing phase
growing.soil: Loose, well-draining, fertile soil with a neutral to slightly acidic pH

planting.whenToPlant: Early spring from sets or seeds; in warmer zones, can be fall-planted
planting.depth: Plant sets 1 inch deep; seeds 1/4 inch deep

careAndMaintenance.pruning: Not typically required; remove flower stalks if they form to encourage bulb development
careAndMaintenance.general: Keep weed-free as onions have shallow roots; mulch to conserve moisture and suppress weeds

harvestingAndUsage.whenToHarvest: When tops begin to yellow and fall over
harvestingAndUsage.howToHarvest: Loosen soil and gently lift bulbs; cure in a dry, airy spot for 2-3 weeks before storing
harvestingAndUsage.preservation: Store cured bulbs in a cool, dry place; can also be chopped and frozen

ecologicalInfo.pollinators: If left to flower, will attract bees and other beneficial insects
